Topic.Title: Amzn will be ok

Message.Msg: Bozo is the greatest snake oil salesman. A lot of empty promises. And after 25 years of operation, still no dividend because there is no real money made to pay shareholders. This company is a non-profit organization, whose existence is designed to enrich insiders. The price of the stock is based on 100% faith/hope that one day, all of these investments will make big money.

Topic.Title: AMZN DOOMED

Message.Msg: Just make sure you are comfortable with the break even price at expiration and remember you can lose 100%. Good luck.

Message.Title: Why this stock will increase in the long term.
Message.Msg: Analysts said its aggressive expansion plans and investment in new products had hit profits. But sales of digital content helped boost revenues for the quarter by 22% to more than $16bn. Its gross profit margin - a closely-watched measure by investors - also increased to 26.6%, from 24% a year ago. In recent months, Amazon has been investing heavily in building new warehouses to improve delivery times, as well as launching new products such as its Kindle range and online film and video content. Analysts say its strategy is to ensure longer-term success at the cost of short-term profits.

Topic.Title: Why this stock will increase in the long term.

Message.Msg: " longer-term success at the cost of short-term profits."??? That's where they get you..has the long tern been defined? Is there even a range? The answer is NO...been listening to this the last several years. AMZN might make $1 some quarter but if you think there will be a time when they will 4 quarters in a row...then you are beyond help.

Topic.Title: Why this stock will increase in the long term.

Message.Msg: Loyalty for a stock in obvious decline is not the best case scenario. AMZN had a great run that lasted longer than anyone could imagine. The problem now is they cannot grow revenue to justify an out of control bubble valuation. Thursday and Friday were just the beginning. This retrace will be swift and deep. The bull case for AMZN may have a chance after the pullback is complete - maybe by the holidays.

Topic.Title: Rewarding Mediocrity

Message.Msg: selling Kindles at a loss into a tablet market where everyone else is getting fat margins, is just ridiculous Venture capitalists ruin perfectly good systems out there and replace them with ponzis which they try to sell to main street.

Topic.Title: Rewarding Mediocrity

Message.Msg: Of course, AMZN is just an efficient fulfillment house and won't see AAPL thick retail margins. Order entered on web, packing slip and label prints to pull a ready product in a warehouse and onto a freight carrier. Big deal this ain't rocket science. AMZN risks killing off growth with higher pricing because competition is heating up. Sites like newegg and tigerdirect are ripping Amazon a new one in the electronics area.

But alas, when this pig doez drop below 120, bandwaggon shorts will pile on at 30%+ short interest on stale reports, which could make this pig go 'netflix' whose stock bounced from 52 to 222 in 3 months, most of which happened in 5 select dayz - god save the shoets that bet the farm on that one when it waz sub 100, but nflx now screamz "short me!". Message.Title: Sold AMZN and bought JC Penney 2k shares but
Message.Msg: I sold all of my AMZN stock and bought 2,000 shares of JCP at $17.04 Friday. I even went to the mall this morning and shopped at Penney's. I forgot how crazy it is going to the mall,parking,walking, dealing with clerks,loud angry customers returning clothes,people coughing over the merchandise, clothes on the floor, trying on shoes that other people wore,and security cameras all over the place watching to see if you might steal a $10 pair of sunglasses. This is not fun but real torture. I ended up buying a Subway Sandwich and bought new Nike shoes with my Kindle Fire in the corner of Treasure Coast Mall. They will be delivered to my house on Monday. I plan on selling all of my JCP stock and average back into AMZN next week.

Message.Title: Profit margins in retail & cloud will probably always never justify this valuation
Message.Msg: Retail profit margins notoriously skimpy, and cloud storage margins also will be less than expected imho because new competition will keep them low. So if earnings don't rise much to justify price, the stock price muct come way down to justify the earnings. At least to the mid $100 level, maybe lower.

Message.Title: Lots of pent up hate in this pup, but low short interest
Message.Msg: Its now just a matter of cap world and fido bots UNFUCKINLOADING this pig in DROVEZ. It can be inferred that they've been under a 3 month distribution cycle az this pig haz failed to put in a new high while the markets have, so it can be assumed that those sneaky bot runnerz have been selling into market strength to ever hopeful bagz. Until the market az a whole turnz and crashez, this will fall at a seemingly alarming rate, yet it will be moderate in relative termz. Large drops will be accompanied by glorious short squeezez, az the pile on bandwaggon shorts jump in and create some nice fvck en pops to short. It will rise during shortsqueezez of 15% short interest band waggonerz, but rise under the premise that : A 50% drop requirez a 100% gain, so a 30% shoet squeeze from 120 wont add up to the baggie lossez, only give them false hope az they hang on for dear life. When the markets do go into crash mode, this pig will trade sub 30.00. The end. Sybil.

Topic.Title: i am leaning toward amzn recovering next week

Message.Msg: This might be a mistake.... You'll alwayz want to keep a base load of shorts and swing trade around that base loaded position by shorting the rips and covering the dips. If this pig managez to rize again then you'll want to have more shorts then what you have now the next time it hits this level in the fall, if it rizez. What you DONT want to do iz bet 'all in' short here, just in case a well funded hedgie deciedz to pull a crazy ivan and take this thing to 320 by sparking off forced short covering. You dont want to be the one stuck having to cover while sybil iz shorting the sharez that have fallen out of your dead bloody hand that iz grasping the mouse that clicked 'buy to cover'. Furthermore dont trade optionz. They are the scam siren call of the cboe, claiming that you will be rich instantly for a 200.00 trade. If you buy 200.00 of optionz then you will lose 180.00 to 200.00 - get it? Finally,sybs says all of this because you dont want to find that you've covered for a 'bounce' az it drops from here to 220, then accelerates lower to 205 and 180 az you wait for that 'bounce', which will never be satisfying enough for you to chase it. People arent emotionally built to chase. If you cover 255 shorts, you wont want to reopen them at 205 - you need to trust sybil: short trade this pig around a core short position.
